text: Ever notice your stop loss gets hit... then price reverses immediately?
That's not bad luck. That's stop hunting.
Big players can see where retail traders place their stops. Right below support. Right above resistance.
They push price just far enough to trigger those stops. Then reverse.
Your stop becomes their entry. Your loss becomes their profit.
So what do you do? First: use mental stops. Don't show your hand.
Second: widen your stops. Give the trade room to breathe.
Third: place stops at less obvious levels. Not where everyone else does.
Stop hunting is real. But now you know how to avoid it.
